com.p4535992.util.string

Class StringOutputStreamKit

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.OutputStream
      • com.p4535992.util.string.StringOutputStreamKit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class StringOutputStreamKit
extends java.io.OutputStream
implements java.io.Serializable
    Provides a OutputStream to an internal String. Internally converts bytes to a Strings. storing them in an internal StringBuffer. Converts the bytes to chars, each char having as its lower 8 bits the value of each byte. Created from 4535992 2015-05-05
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.lang.StringBuffer buf
      The internal StringBuffer to contain all the data written to this OutputStream.

      • write

        public void write(byte[] b)
        Writes and appends a byte array to the internal StringBuffer. bytes are copied to chars, each char having as its lower 8 bits the value of each byte.
        Overrides:
        write in class java.io.OutputStream
        Parameters:
        b - the byte array to write to the internal StringBuffer.

      • write

        public void write(byte[] b,
         int off,
         int len)
        Writes and appends a byte array to the internal StringBuffer. bytes are copied to chars, each char having as its lower 8 bits the value of each byte.
        Overrides:
        write in class java.io.OutputStream
        Parameters:
        b - the byte array to write to the internal StringBuffer.
        off - the index of byte array b to start reading from.
        len - the number of bytes from byte array b to read into internal StringBuffer.

      • write

        public void write(int b)
        Writes and appends a single byte as an int to the internal StringBuffer. The int is copied to a char, having as its value the lower eight bits of the int.
        Specified by:
        write in class java.io.OutputStream
        Parameters:
        b - the byte as an int add to the internal StringBuffer, taking the lower eight bits of the int as the value of the char.

      • convertStringToBytes

        public static byte[] convertStringToBytes(java.lang.String Str)
        Converts a String to a byte array, taking the eight lower bits of each char as the eight bits of the bytes for the byte array.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the new byte array converted from a String.

      • replaceBytes

        public static byte[] replaceBytes(byte[] Bytes,
                  char Old,
                  char New)
        Replaces all occurences of char of one type with another char in a given byte array and returns it. Change is made to the byte array and it is also returned.
        Parameters:
        Bytes - the byte array to change bytes in.
        Old - the char to find, converted to a byte by the lower eight bits, ignoring the higher eight bits.
        New - the char to replace all occurences of Old char converted to a byte by the lower eight bits, ignoring the higher eight bits.
        Returns:
        the changed byte array.

      • replaceBytes

        public static byte[] replaceBytes(byte[] Bytes,
                  java.lang.String Old,
                  java.lang.String New)
        Replaces one String with another where it occurs of a byte array making a new array due to the possibility of different size. Goes through the array just once, so any new occurances of Old String that appear due to the New String replacement are not replaced. Does no change to the byte array parameter Bytes.
        Parameters:
        Bytes - the byte array copy and search through but does no change to this parameter, returning the resulting byte array.
        Old - the old String to replace.
        New - the new String to replace Old String with.
        Returns:
        the new byte array with replacements done.

      • writeBytes

        public static void writeBytes(java.io.FileOutputStream OPut,
              byte[] bbuf)
                       throws java.lang.Exception

        Convenience method for writing bytes to an OutputStream. Closes resources within a try finally block.

        Parameters:

        bbuf - The contents to write to the OutputStream, OPut.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Probably an IO Exception if any.

        Convenience method for reading bytes from an InputStream. Closes resources within a try finally block.

        Parameters:
        IPut - InputStream to read from.
        Returns:

        Throws:

      • replace

        public static java.lang.String replace(java.lang.String Text,
                       java.lang.String Old,
                       java.lang.String New)

        Used to replace one String segment with another String segment inside a String. Similar to the replace method in String but instead of using char it uses String for replacing old with new.

        Parameters:
        Text - The String from which is produced the new String with which replacement has occurred.
        Old - The old String that is replaced by the new one in The Text String.
        New - The new String to replace the old String in the Text String.
        Returns:
        The new String with replacement having occurred.
